tags: track, heading, drift, closing angle, correction, navigation
title: Track and Heading

questions.question: What is a Position Line (PL?)
questions.answer: A line an aircraft is known to be on at a particular time.

questions.question: What are examples of physical features that can give position lines?
What is a transit bearing?
questions.answer: A bearing obtained from two or more features positioned on the Track Made Good (TMG).

questions.question: Given a position line, what else is required to obtain a fix? What is a desirable property of this other feature?
questions.answer: One or more additional lines, ideally crossing as close to 90° as possible.

questions.question: What is a non-visual method of plotting a fix using a pre-determined position line?
questions.answer: Obtaining a fix from a navigation beacon.

questions.question: A fix obtained using navigation aids is generally (more/less) accurate than by using visual references.
What piece of navigation equipment can be useful for determining groundspeed (that doesn't give a direct groundspeed readout)?
How can visual references be used to determine drift?
questions.answer: Tracking along a straight visual line (eg. railroad, coast line) and noting whether your distance from the line is increasing, decreasing, or remaining constant.

questions.question: During flight planning, which track is determined?
What value do you calculate during flight planning to maintain the FPT?
What is the major cause that results in the FPT requiring adjustment in flight, and what is the adjusted track called?
questions.answer: Actual winds being different to forecast winds used for flight planning. Actual track in flight is called the Track Made Good (TMG).

questions.question: The angle between the required track and TMG is called the __________, specified in ____________________.
questions.answer: Track Error (TE). Degrees left or right of track.

questions.question: The angle between the HDG and FPT is called the __________.
Angle between the HDG and TMG is called the __________.
Angle between the FPT and TMG is called the __________.
After realising the TMG has diverged from the FPT, you can calculate and apply the TE. Flying this new heading will __________ the FPT.
In addition to applying a correction to the TMG, to return to the FPT you must apply an additional correction, called the __________.
What is the relationship between CA and time/distance to get re-established on the FPT?
questions.answer: A larger closing will get you re-established on the FPT sooner. A shallower angle will take longer to re-establish on the FPT.

questions.question: The combination of Track Error (TE) and Closing Angle (CA) is called the __________.
The TC is normally approximate, because ____________________.
questions.answer: It assumes groundspeed and wind velocity are constant, which is unlikely to be the case.

questions.question: If the TE or CA is greater than _____°, then the approximation is __________ and the TC will need to be __________.
questions.answer: 15. Invalid. Calculated on a flight computer.
